channel.title: Anti-Spam | Chat timer? REP++ for answer!
channel.description:
I was logged on to a friends server and one of his players asked me my IP for my server, I typed it in clicked enter and it ****** starred it out. I also noticed if on his server when you do ::yell (hi) [what ever message you want] if you say it too many times it automatically mutes you.
I'm running a DELTA server and I was wondering if there is any codes that I can add both of these features to my server.
'THANKS' for optimistic replies :)
Lol. Thanks!

item.title: Anti-Spam | Chat timer? REP++ for answer!
item.dc:creator: @lostmyphat lostmyphat
item.description:
@lostmyphat wrote:

public long chatThrottle = 0L; public String lastChat = "
Add these were there are others things that start with “public long” and “public string”.

Read full topic

}[/quote]

Yeah I’m sorry this still doesn’t help.
So im at this point-

The command you edited and fixed is working but can’t work until I have these two added:

public long chatThrottle = 0L; public String lastChat = "
but I have no idea where to add them. Is there something I can search in my client.java and just paste it right underneath that? I'm sorry if this is upsetting you there is just some things I don't understand. But when people help me with my problems and there fixed I will most def. understand it.

item.title: Anti-Spam | Chat timer? REP++ for answer!
item.dc:creator: @JGX JGX
item.description:
@JGX wrote:

[quote=“Coelho, post:21, topic:412636”][quote author=JGX link=topic=514115.msg3732127#msg3732127 date=1314671459]

Defining the variables is just copying and pasting the code inside the main constructor? (public class blah)

Hm. Okay. Well take a look at my last post. Any clues on how to fix this error?
[/quote]
You are not using the code I gave you, thus I will not help with that.

Just noticed a bug, and fixed it for you.

Define the variables:

public long chatThrottle = 0L;
public String lastChat = "";

Replace your yell method (I did some code cleanup for you too!):

[code]
if (command.startsWith(“yell”) && command.length() > 5 && playerRights >= 0) {
String title = “”;
String text = command.substring(5);

if (playerRights == 1) {
	title = "@whi@[Moderator]-@bla@ ";
} else if (playerRights == 2) {
	title = "@yel@[Administrator]-@bla@ ";
} else if (playerRights == 3) {
	title = "@blu@[Co-Owner]-@bla@ ";
} else if (playerRights == 4) {
	title = "@blu@[xxx]-@red@ ";
} else if (donator == 1) {
	title = "@blu@[xxx]-@bla@";
} else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("xxx")) {
	title = "@red@[Owner]@red@";
} else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("xxxi")) {
	title = "@red@[Co-Owner]@bla@";
} else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("xxx")) {
	title = "@red@[Co-Owner]@bla@";
}

if(System.currentTimeMillis() - chatThrottle < 1500L && lastChat.equalsIgnoreCase(text))
	kick(); //CHANGE THIS
else if(System.currentTimeMillis() - chatThrottle < 750L)
	kick(); //CHANGE THIS

lastChat = text;
chatThrottle = System.currentTimeMillis();

yell(title + "" + playerName + ": " + text);

} else if(muted) {
sM(“You are muted you cannot yell!”);
}
[/code][/quote]

Okay I will use yours.

Now I C&P

public long chatThrottle = 0L; public String lastChat = "";

anywhere? and do I do

public long chatThrottle = 0L; } public String lastChat = " }
?

Read full topic
item.source: Anti-Spam | Chat timer? REP++ for answer!

item.title: Anti-Spam | Chat timer? REP++ for answer!
item.dc:creator: @Coelho Coelho
item.description:
@Coelho wrote:

[quote=“JGX, post:20, topic:412636”][quote author=Coelho link=topic=514115.msg3732125#msg3732125 date=1314671419]
Defining the variables is just copying and pasting the code inside the main constructor? (public class blah)
[/quote]

Hm. Okay. Well take a look at my last post. Any clues on how to fix this error?[/quote]
You are not using the code I gave you, thus I will not help with that.

Just noticed a bug, and fixed it for you.

Define the variables:

public long chatThrottle = 0L;
public String lastChat = "";

Replace your yell method (I did some code cleanup for you too!):

if (command.startsWith("yell") && command.length() > 5 && playerRights >= 0) { 
	String title = "";
	String text = command.substring(5);

	if (playerRights == 1) {
		title = "@whi@[Moderator]-@bla@ ";
	} else if (playerRights == 2) {
		title = "@yel@[Administrator]-@bla@ ";
	} else if (playerRights == 3) {
		title = "@blu@[Co-Owner]-@bla@ ";
	} else if (playerRights == 4) {
		title = "@blu@[xxx]-@red@ ";
	} else if (donator == 1) {
		title = "@blu@[xxx]-@bla@";
	} else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("xxx")) {
		title = "@red@[Owner]@red@";
	} else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("xxxi")) {
		title = "@red@[Co-Owner]@bla@";
	} else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("xxx")) {
		title = "@red@[Co-Owner]@bla@";
	}

	if(System.currentTimeMillis() - chatThrottle < 1500L && lastChat.equalsIgnoreCase(text))
		kick(); //CHANGE THIS
	else if(System.currentTimeMillis() - chatThrottle < 750L)
		kick(); //CHANGE THIS

	lastChat = text;
	chatThrottle = System.currentTimeMillis();

	yell(title + "" + playerName + ": " + text);
} else if(muted) {
	sM("You are muted you cannot yell!");
}

Read full topic

[quote=“imsuperman05, post:17, topic:412636”] if (command.startsWith("yell") && command.length() > 5 && playerRights >= 0) { String titles = ""; if(System.currentTimeMillis() - c.lastyell < 50) { muted = true; writeLog(playerName, "mutes"); sM("You can only yell once per 45 seconds."); return; } if (playerRights == 1) { titles = "@whi@[Moderator]-@bla@ "; } if (playerRights == 2) { titles = "@yel@[Administrator]-@bla@ "; } if (playerRights == 3) { titles = "@blu@[Co-Owner]-@bla@ "; } if (playerRights == 4) { titles = "@blu@[xxx]-@red@ "; } if (donator == 1) { titles = "@blu@[xxx]-@bla@"; } if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("xxx")) { titles = "@red@[Owner]@red@"; } if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("xxxi")) { titles = "@red@[Co-Owner]@bla@"; } if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("xxx")) { titles = "@red@[Co-Owner]@bla@"; } yell(titles + "" + playerName + ": " + command.substring(5)); } else { if(muted){ sM("You are muted you cannot yell!"); } }[/quote]

Added that, however, I still got 1 error.

OKAY- I just saw you said take the “c.” I did. I got the same error just now without the “c.”

item.dc:creator: @JGX JGX
item.description:
@JGX wrote:

[quote=“Coelho, post:14, topic:412636”]Define the variables:

public long chatThrottle = 0L;
public String lastChat = "";

Replace your yell method (I did some code cleanup for you too!):

if (command.startsWith("yell") && command.length() > 5 && playerRights >= 0) { 
	String title = "";
	String text = command.substring(5);

	if (playerRights == 1) {
		title = "@whi@[Moderator]-@bla@ ";
	} else if (playerRights == 2) {
		title = "@yel@[Administrator]-@bla@ ";
	} else if (playerRights == 3) {
		title = "@blu@[Co-Owner]-@bla@ ";
	} else if (playerRights == 4) {
		title = "@blu@[xxx]-@red@ ";
	} else if (donator == 1) {
		title = "@blu@[xxx]-@bla@";
	} else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("xxx")) {
		title = "@red@[Owner]@red@";
	} else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("xxxi")) {
		title = "@red@[Co-Owner]@bla@";
	} else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("xxx")) {
		title = "@red@[Co-Owner]@bla@";
	}

	if(System.currentTimeMillis() - chatThrottle > 1500L && lastChat.equalsIgnoreCase(text))
		kick(); //CHANGE THIS
	else if(System.currentTimeMillis() - chatThrottle > 750L)
		kick(); //CHANGE THIS

	lastChat = text;
	chatThrottle = System.currentTimeMillis();

	yell(title + "" + playerName + ": " + text);
} else if(muted) {
	sM("You are muted you cannot yell!");
}

You can do a little more code cleanup (add “this.”, make private vars, etc), but I really cba. Also you can add a warning system yourself pretty easily, I just did the bare minimum.[/quote]

I saw your signature. Lmao, I’m only making the server for fun.
Your probably going to get pissed at me asking this but…

Sorry for asking but there is no other way for me to learn:)

item.title: Anti-Spam | Chat timer? REP++ for answer!
item.dc:creator: @Coelho Coelho
item.description:
@Coelho wrote:

Define the variables:

public long chatThrottle = 0L;
public String lastChat = "";

Replace your yell method (I did some code cleanup for you too!):

if (command.startsWith("yell") && command.length() > 5 && playerRights >= 0) { 
	String title = "";
	String text = command.substring(5);

	if (playerRights == 1) {
		title = "@whi@[Moderator]-@bla@ ";
	} else if (playerRights == 2) {
		title = "@yel@[Administrator]-@bla@ ";
	} else if (playerRights == 3) {
		title = "@blu@[Co-Owner]-@bla@ ";
	} else if (playerRights == 4) {
		title = "@blu@[xxx]-@red@ ";
	} else if (donator == 1) {
		title = "@blu@[xxx]-@bla@";
	} else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("xxx")) {
		title = "@red@[Owner]@red@";
	} else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("xxxi")) {
		title = "@red@[Co-Owner]@bla@";
	} else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("xxx")) {
		title = "@red@[Co-Owner]@bla@";
	}

	if(System.currentTimeMillis() - chatThrottle > 1500L && lastChat.equalsIgnoreCase(text))
		kick(); //CHANGE THIS
	else if(System.currentTimeMillis() - chatThrottle > 750L)
		kick(); //CHANGE THIS

	lastChat = text;
	chatThrottle = System.currentTimeMillis();

	yell(title + "" + playerName + ": " + text);
} else if(muted) {
	sM("You are muted you cannot yell!");
}

You can do a little more code cleanup (add “this.”, make private vars, etc), but I really cba. Also you can add a warning system yourself pretty easily, I just did the bare minimum.

item.dc:creator: @JGX JGX
item.description:
@JGX wrote:

imsuperman05:

show me your :yell command, and mute.

::yell command

if (command.startsWith("yell") && command.length() > 5 && playerRights >= 0) { String titles = "";

if (playerRights == 1) {
titles = "@whi@[Moderator]-@bla@ ";
}
if (playerRights == 2) {
titles = "@yel@[Administrator]-@bla@ ";
}
if (playerRights == 3) {
titles = "@blu@[Co-Owner]-@bla@ ";
}
if (playerRights == 4) {
titles = "@blu@[xxx]-@red@ ";
}
if (donator == 1) {
titles = “@blu@[xxx]-@bla@”;
}
if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“xxx”)) {
titles = “@red@[Owner]@red@”;
}
if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“xxxi”)) {
titles = “@red@[Co-Owner]@bla@”;
}
if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“xxx”)) {
titles = “@red@[Co-Owner]@bla@”;
}
yell(titles + “” + playerName + ": "

  • command.substring(5));
    } else {
    if(muted){
    sM(“You are muted you cannot yell!”);
    }
    }

::mute

if (command.startsWith("mute") && playerRights >= 1) {

try {

String otherPName = command.substring(5);

int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(otherPName);

if (otherPIndex != -1) {

client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex];

p.muted = true;

writeLog(p.playerName, “mutes”);

sM(“You have muted “+p.playerName+”!”);

yell("["+playerName+"] has just Muted “+p.playerName+”!");

} else {

sM(“The name doesnt exist.”);

}

} catch (Exception e) {

sM(“Try entering a name you want to mute…”);

}

}

	 </blockquote>

item.title: Anti-Spam | Chat timer? REP++ for answer!
item.dc:creator: @Coelho Coelho
item.description:
@Coelho wrote:

Define the variable:

public long chatThrottle;

Add the throttle:

if(command.startsWith("yell")) {
	if(System.currentTimeMillis() - chatThrottle > 1000) //EDIT TIME
		kickNoob(); // EDIT THIS
	chatThrottle = System.currentTimeMillis();
	...
}

If you want a better one (with warnings and etc), you are going to need to make it yourself.

Read full topic
